result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam Louis Rivas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Transcript SENTENCING, commencing JUNE 2, 2016, received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 16CF406 (27 Pages).

Defendant in court for sentencing as to Case# 16CF00406.

Restitution request submitted as to this case.  Restitution ordered as to this request on the sentence as to Case# 16CF00406.
Clerk:  jms
submitted to the court as to sentencing on Case# 16CF00406
Bail refund
4/1/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.
Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Adam Louis Rivas in court with Attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Adam Louis Rivas in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
This case transferred from Branch 21.

Defendant entered a plea on today's date as to Case# 16CF000406.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders this case dismissed, but read-in as to sentencing.
Case adjourned for status on the sentencing date as to Case#  16CF000406.
Clerk:  jms

Clerk was contacted by attorney Michael Jude and advised that Judge Sanders, Branch 28 has agreed to accept this case as part of a global resolution.  Case transferred to Judge Sanders, Branch 28 FORTHWITH.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Adam Louis Rivas not in court, in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant has a felony case in Branch 28.  Branch 21 allows for a global resolution of the case in Branch 28.    Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Adam Louis Rivas not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Adam Louis Rivas in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adam Louis Rivas in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case is scheduled for plea hearing today.  The defendant has a pending matter scheduled for jury trial.  Case passed.

Defendant Adam Louis Rivas in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant has a pending matter that's scheduled for jury trial before this court.  This case will be scheduled on same day of trial.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adam Louis Rivas in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense requested a jury trial date on the companion case.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Adam Louis Rivas in court with attorney Edgar Lin for Torrie R. Williams.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Attorney  Williams is in mandatory training today but will need time to review discovery with the defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

06/21/2015

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Adam Louis Rivas not in court, in custody.  
Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Parties engaged in negotiations for global resolution with 15CM000411.  Defense motion for adjournment granted.   Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Adam Louis Rivas not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Pick N Save located at 250 W. Holt Ave., Milwaukee, Wisconsin, or Walgreen's located at 6292 S. 27th St., Milwaukee, Wisconsin.

Defendant Adam Louis Rivas in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Adam Louis Rivas in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Protasiewicz, Br. 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
